name: FIN8
descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) is a financially motivated threat group that has been active since at least January 2016, and known for targeting organizations in the hospitality, retail, entertainment, insurance, technology, chemical, and financial sectors. In June 2021, security researchers detected [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) switching from targeting point-of-sale (POS) devices to distributing a number of ransomware variants.(Citation: FireEye Obfuscation June 2017)(Citation: FireEye Fin8 May 2016)(Citation: Bitdefender Sardonic Aug 2021)(Citation: Symantec FIN8 Jul 2023)

subtechniques.name: Token Impersonation/Theft
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used a malicious framework designed to impersonate the lsass.exe/vmtoolsd.exe token.(Citation: Bitdefender FIN8 July 2021)(Citation: Symantec FIN8 Jul 2023)

subtechniques.name: Web Protocols
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used HTTPS for command and control.(Citation: Bitdefender FIN8 July 2021)

subtechniques.name: Archive via Utility
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used RAR to compress collected data before exfiltration.(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)

subtechniques.name: PowerShell
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061)'s malicious spearphishing payloads are executed as [PowerShell](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1059/001). [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has also used [PowerShell](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1059/001) for lateral movement and credential access.(Citation: FireEye Obfuscation June 2017)(Citation: Bitdefender FIN8 July 2021)(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)(Citation: Symantec FIN8 Jul 2023)

subtechniques.name: Windows Command Shell
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used a Batch file to automate frequently executed post compromise cleanup activities.(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016) [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has also executed commands remotely via `cmd.exe`.(Citation: FireEye Obfuscation June 2017)(Citation: Bitdefender FIN8 July 2021)(Citation: Symantec FIN8 Jul 2023)

technique_table_data.name: Data Encrypted for Impact
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has deployed ransomware such as [Ragnar Locker](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0481), White Rabbit, and attempted to execute Noberus on compromised networks.(Citation: Symantec FIN8 Jul 2023)

subtechniques.name: Remote Data Staging
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) aggregates staged data from a network into a single location.(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)

technique_table_data.name: Domain Trust Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has retrieved a list of trusted domains by using nltest.exe /domain_trusts.(Citation: Bitdefender FIN8 July 2021)

subtechniques.name: Asymmetric Cryptography
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used the Plink utility to tunnel RDP back to C2 infrastructure.(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)

subtechniques.name: Windows Management Instrumentation Event Subscription
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used WMI event subscriptions for persistence.(Citation: Bitdefender FIN8 July 2021)

subtechniques.name: Exfiltration Over Unencrypted Non-C2 Protocol
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used FTP to exfiltrate collected data.(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)

technique_table_data.name: Exploitation for Privilege Escalation
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has exploited the CVE-2016-0167 local vulnerability.(Citation: FireEye Fin8 May 2016)(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)

subtechniques.name: Clear Windows Event Logs
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has cleared logs during post compromise cleanup activities.(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)

subtechniques.name: File Deletion
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has deleted tmp and prefetch files during post compromise cleanup activities. [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has also deleted PowerShell scripts to evade detection on compromised machines.(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)(Citation: Symantec FIN8 Jul 2023)

technique_table_data.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used remote code execution to download subsequent payloads.(Citation: FireEye Fin8 May 2016)(Citation: Bitdefender FIN8 July 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Modify Registry
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has deleted Registry keys during post compromise cleanup activities.(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)

subtechniques.name: Command Obfuscation
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used environment variables and standard input (stdin) to obfuscate command-line arguments. [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) also obfuscates malicious macros delivered as payloads.(Citation: FireEye Obfuscation June 2017)(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)(Citation: Bitdefender FIN8 July 2021)

subtechniques.name: Tool
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used open-source tools such as [Impacket](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0357) for targeting efforts.(Citation: Bitdefender Sardonic Aug 2021)

subtechniques.name: Code Signing Certificates
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used an expired open-source X.509 certificate for testing in the OpenSSL repository, to connect to actor-controlled C2 servers.(Citation: Bitdefender Sardonic Aug 2021)

subtechniques.name: LSASS Memory
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) harvests credentials using Invoke-Mimikatz or Windows Credentials Editor (WCE).(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has distributed targeted emails containing Word documents with embedded malicious macros.(Citation: FireEye Obfuscation June 2017)(Citation: FireEye Fin8 May 2016)(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Link
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has distributed targeted emails containing links to malicious documents with embedded macros.(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)

subtechniques.name: Asynchronous Procedure Call
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has injected malicious code into a new svchost.exe process.(Citation: Bitdefender FIN8 July 2021)

subtechniques.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used RDP for lateral movement.(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)

subtechniques.name: SMB/Windows Admin Shares
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has attempted to map to C$ on enumerated hosts to test the scope of their current credentials/context. [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has also used smbexec from the [Impacket](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0357) suite for lateral movement.(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)(Citation: Bitdefender Sardonic Aug 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Remote System Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used [dsquery](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0105) and other Active Directory utilities to enumerate hosts; they have also used nltest.exe /dclist to retrieve a list of domain controllers.(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)(Citation: Bitdefender FIN8 July 2021)

subtechniques.name: Scheduled Task
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used scheduled tasks to maintain RDP backdoors.(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)

subtechniques.name: Security Software Discovery
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used Registry keys to detect and avoid executing in potential sandboxes.(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)

technique_table_data.name: System Information Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used PowerShell Scripts to check the architecture of a compromised machine before the selection of a 32-bit or 64-bit version of a malicious .NET loader.(Citation: Symantec FIN8 Jul 2023)

subtechniques.name: Internet Connection Discovery
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used the [Ping](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0097) command to check connectivity to actor-controlled C2 servers.(Citation: Bitdefender Sardonic Aug 2021)

technique_table_data.name: System Owner/User Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has executed the command `quser` to display the session details of a compromised machine.(Citation: Symantec FIN8 Jul 2023)

subtechniques.name: Malicious Link
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used emails with malicious links to lure victims into installing malware.(Citation: FireEye Obfuscation June 2017)(Citation: FireEye Fin8 May 2016)(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)

subtechniques.name: Malicious File
subtechniques.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used malicious e-mail attachments to lure victims into executing malware.(Citation: FireEye Obfuscation June 2017)(Citation: FireEye Fin8 May 2016)(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)

technique_table_data.name: Valid Accounts
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used valid accounts for persistence and lateral movement.(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)

technique_table_data.name: Web Service
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used sslip.io, a free IP to domain mapping service that also makes SSL certificate generation easier for traffic encryption, as part of their command and control.(Citation: Bitdefender FIN8 July 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061)'s malicious spearphishing payloads use WMI to launch malware and spawn `cmd.exe` execution. [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has also used WMIC and the [Impacket](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0357) suite for lateral movement, as well as during and post compromise cleanup activities.(Citation: FireEye Obfuscation June 2017)(Citation: Bitdefender FIN8 July 2021)(Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)(Citation: Symantec FIN8 Jul 2023)

software_data.name: dsquery
software_data.descr: (Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)

software_data.name: Impacket
software_data.descr: (Citation: Bitdefender FIN8 July 2021)(Citation: Bitdefender Sardonic Aug 2021)

software_data.name: Net
software_data.descr: (Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)

techniques.name: Masquerading
techniques.sub_name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location

software_data.name: Sardonic
software_data.descr: (Citation: Bitdefender Sardonic Aug 2021)(Citation: Symantec FIN8 Jul 2023)

FireEye Obfuscation June 2017.description: Bohannon, D. & Carr N. (2017, June 30). Obfuscation in the Wild: Targeted Attackers Lead the Way in Evasion Techniques. Retrieved February 12, 2018.

Bitdefender Sardonic Aug 2021.description: Budaca, E., et al. (2021, August 25). FIN8 Threat Actor Goes Agile with New Sardonic Backdoor. Retrieved August 9, 2023.

FireEye Fin8 May 2016.description: Kizhakkinan, D., et al. (2016, May 11). Threat Actor Leverages Windows Zero-day Exploit in Payment Card Data Attacks. Retrieved February 12, 2018.

Symantec FIN8 Jul 2023.description: Symantec Threat Hunter Team. (2023, July 18). FIN8 Uses Revamped Sardonic Backdoor to Deliver Noberus Ransomware. Retrieved August 9, 2023.

FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016.description: Elovitz, S. & Ahl, I. (2016, August 18). Know Your Enemy:  New Financially-Motivated & Spear-Phishing Group. Retrieved February 26, 2018.

Bitdefender FIN8 July 2021.description: Martin Zugec. (2021, July 27). Deep Dive Into a FIN8 Attack - A Forensic Investigation. Retrieved September 1, 2021.

BitDefender BADHATCH Mar 2021.description: Vrabie, V., et al. (2021, March 10). FIN8 Returns with Improved BADHATCH Toolkit. Retrieved September 8, 2021.
